Hatred.

Over time, I found out that, on top of being a deep feeling, it is=

also a terribly useful tool. Sharing that hatred makes people see
things y=
ou own way, and such an agreement is the beginning of an alliance.

*******=
*************************

Magnum had been in relay for some time now. Desp=
ite his massive
appearance, he managed to stay hidden most of the time. He =
was vaguely
known, asa rumor in the hoodlums of the city.

Little by little=
, he approached Silver Wings throughout the city. He
spoke with them, liste=
ned to them. They had been ravaged by the
uprising the Iron Skulls had lead=
 and viewed Jotunn's demotion as a
candy punishment. The perpetrators, the =
soldiers themselves, had
barely been chastised for that, and resentment was=
 strong because of
this inaction among the surviving population.

He agreed=
 with them, and told them they should get even in one way or
another. Like =
a prophet, people took him to heart and remembered him.
He was hope for the=
 wounded, the hope of recovery and vengeance. He
only asked them not to spe=
ak directly of him. His influence grew by
the cycle.

*********************=
************

Intelligence reports had been scarce inside the city. Deadfur=
 didn't
like that. They'd lost contacts there, and he'd decided to stay to
=
help rebuilding

When an agent told him someone looking like the missing Se=
rgeant Ultra
Magnus was talking of getting back at the Iron Skulls in the p=
eople's
area, that worried him. But, he didn't want to take decisions on th=
at
himself. He went to Razorwing and handed him the datapad that
contained =
the report.

Deafur: What d'you make of that? Should we worry?
